ygData.subject: Re: Food/rations
ygData.msgSnippet: Kale, I have noticed that each food item seems to last the same amount of time, they seem only to varry in cost.  The one exception that i have come across
ygData.messageBody:
Kale,

I have noticed that each food item seems to last the same amount of time,
they seem only to varry in cost. The one exception that i have come across
occurs in the desert. While within a desert zone(ie. Desert of Ro), water
seems to last half its normal time. If you cannot summon, fish or forage
for food, i have found that muffins@6cp and milk@7cp are the most cost
effeicent food supply.

Lance

-----Original Message-----
From: kale usi [mailto:kaleusi@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 17, 1999 9:05 AM
To: EverQuest@onelist.com
Subject: [EverQuest] Food/rations


From: kale usi <kaleusi@...>

I was wondering if there was any real difference to the rations/food you can

buy or obtain, (like one lasts longer or gives a specific benefit) other
than weight, cost and perhaps personal preferance (IE - you prefer to carry
fish instead of bread)? The reason I'm asking, is that I noticed that fish
(which can be gotten by fishing, which costs practically nothing - just the
cost of a fishing rod and bait) seem to last longer than loaves of bread
(cost around 2 SP each). I was wondering if this were true, or just my
perception of it. If this is true however, I wonder if the same were true
for drink (IE - mead or ale would last longer than water)?
